channel.title: Shrouded Greatsword
channel.description: I haven't been active in quite a while. Its good to see this forum still lives. So i decided to throw something together to get myself back into the modeling vibe.

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

The color scheme IMO is really great, but I do have to agree with dd123c5 in the fact it does look a little like a blunt object (at least from this angle). All in all looks really good!

Read full topic

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I know because it’s the same for me, we’re comfortable with modelling so it takes us minutes where it might take others an hour.

I look forward to seeing the next model.

Read full topic

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:541103”]No need to post a wireframe, i can already tell where it is. Not all greatswords, or swords in general don’t have to be pointy but it is the preferred design as it seems like a more plausible method.

I’ve no major problems with the design except for the hilt, i’m not sure what you were aiming for but it seems like a bit of a cluster with the colours and design. The red is just thrown together with the blacks and greys all over the model which would look more pleasant if they were separated in some way. I know it usually works but for some reason it doesn’t work on this model.

From one modeller to another, it seems as though you spent 20 minutes or less on the design and colours to start a thread. Maybe try something harder, new in design or spend as much time as you used to so you can get that end result.[/quote] cx you know me so well. How did you know i made a quick one? 10 minutes actully ^^ but fine ill put more time in my next one.

Read full topic

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

No need to post a wireframe, i can already tell where it is. Not all greatswords, or swords in general don’t have to be pointy but it is the preferred design as it seems like a more plausible method.

I’ve no major problems with the design except for the hilt, i’m not sure what you were aiming for but it seems like a bit of a cluster with the colours and design. The red is just thrown together with the blacks and greys all over the model which would look more pleasant if they were separated in some way. I know it usually works but for some reason it doesn’t work on this model.

From one modeller to another, it seems as though you spent 20 minutes or less on the design and colours to start a thread. Maybe try something harder, new in design or spend as much time as you used to so you can get that end result.

Read full topic

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

For those who are ignorant[quote=“dd123c5, post:2, topic:541103”]no offence but thats not a sword thats like a a rod with a blunt peace of metal on the end and the colors all run together nothing to tell the difference between handle and blade :palm:[/quote] ^^^^^^^^^^!! Not all Greatswords in history have been POINTY! And as for the wire. i Stopped posting mine because its just a waste of time for me. I Keep all my wires very clean. I stopped after i got more advanced with modeling. Just a personal decision really. I just decided to post something. The traffic here isnt like it used to be. And i thought making a POINTY sword was just to cliche. There are tons of historical Swords that were made with Bluntness in mind vs sharpness. And besides it was fun to dabble ^^ just something different i guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

It’s good to see more people back to modeling
The coloring is really nice and the sword looks good too , But why is it cut off from the top?
Also please post a wire frame of the sword if you could so we can rate your work properly

Read full topic

item.title: Shrouded Greatsword
item.dc:creator: @dd123c5 dd123c5
item.description:
@dd123c5 wrote:

no offence but thats not a sword thats like a a rod with a blunt peace of metal on the end and the colors all run together nothing to tell the difference between handle and blade :palm:
